newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: British oil, gas firm in talks with EON, Proton.
newsitem.headline: British oil, gas firm in talks with EON, Proton.

text.p: British engineering company Hamworthy Compressor Systems said on Thursday it is currently in joint-venture talks with a Malaysian company to develop compressor and storage systems for the increased use of natural gas in private and commercial vehicles.
Ashley Watkins, export manager of Hamworthy, said the discussions should be over by December 1996.
He did not name the Malaysian firm which, he said, has a stake in Malaysia's national car maker Perusahaan Otomobil Nasional Bhd (Proton) and its distributor Edaran Otomobil Nasional Bhd (EON).
A local analyst said: "It sounds as if the company has been talking to DRB (Diversified Resources Bhd), who already makes private and commercial vehicles."

Watkins said that Hamworthy, Britain's largest manufacturer of gas compressors for the oil and gas industry, is also currently in negotiations with Malaysia's national oil and gas company Petronas, Shell and Esso oil companies for the supply of natural gas compressors for fuel pumps.

"Initially we will be manufacturing the compressors in the U.K. But we do not just deliver the compressors in a box and then forget about them," he said after a press briefing conducted by visiting British energy minister Lord Fraser of Carmyllie.
Natural gas vehicles (NGVs) burn fuel much more efficiently than conventional vehicles, and are therefore friendlier to the environment.
Hamworthy is in Malaysia as part of a delegation of British oil and gas companies led by Lord Fraser.
Several other companies in the delegation are currently in negotiations with Petronas, as well as the Malaysian operations of Shell and British Petroleum.
Lord Fraser revealed that at least two joint venture agreements had already been agreed upon, but no further details were released at the briefing.
